description: This Python source file provides helper functions for managing an SQLite database, including schema setup, connection management, and utilities for executing queries and fetching data related to users, jobs, and progress within a career path navigator application.

methods.name: None _ensure_schema(conn: sqlite3.Connection)
methods.description: Ensures the database schema exists by creating tables for users, jobs, and progress if they do not already exist.

methods.name: get_conn()
methods.description: Provides a context manager for establishing and closing a database connection, ensuring schema is initialized.

methods.name: list[dict[str,Any]] fetch_all(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Fetches all records matching a query, returning a list of dictionaries representing rows.

methods.name: Optional[dict[str,Any]] fetch_one(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Fetches a single record matching a query, returning a dictionary of the row or None if not found.

methods.name: None execute(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any])
methods.description: Executes a SQL statement, commonly for insert, update, or delete operations, and commits the transaction.

ctags.name: execute
ctags.pattern: /^def execute(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> None:$/

ctags.name: fetch_all
ctags.pattern: /^def fetch_all(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> list[dict[str, Any/

ctags.name: fetch_one
ctags.pattern: /^def fetch_one(conn: sqlite3.Connection, query: str, params: Iterable[Any]) -> Optional[dict[str,/
